data.title: Jeanne Kehren on LinkedIn: Leaps by Bayer

data.text:
We are delighted to welcome Maria Alfaiate as our new Executive Vice President, Commercial and Corporate Strategy! Maria is joining Lundbeck today, August 1, 2024, and is part of Lundbeck's Executive Management team. Maria brings a wealth of experience and a proven track record in strategic commercial leadership from life science and pharmaceutical sectors worldwide. In her new role, Maria will focus on strengthening our corporate strategic functions and enhancing our global marketing efforts. Her expertise in designing and executing innovative plans, along with her deep understanding of global markets, will be instrumental in driving our future growth. Join us in welcoming Maria to the team! #Leadership #FocusedInnovator #BrainHealth

We are excited to announce Jeanne Kehren as our new Chief Executive Officer. Jeanne succeeds our visionary founder, Georges De Feu, who decided to step aside from his role as CEO. We thank Georges for his foundational contributions. As LynxCare continues to grow, we recognize the importance of bringing in specific experience and leadership to drive us through our next phase of development. With Jeanne, we bring onboard a profound expertise in innovative #healthcare #data solutions and experience in accelerating pharmaceutical #innovation through #technology. ğŒğğğ­ ğ‰ğğšğ§ğ§ğ Jeanne began her career at Novartis, enhancing R&D with innovative technologies and data integration. She joined Sanofi in 2009, leading major projects and later reshaping portfolios and strategies. In 2019, she became a Bayer, Pharma Executive committee member heading Digital & Commercial Innovation and added the role of Chief Information Officer Pharmaceuticals in 2021 until end of last year. We are confident that Jeanneâ€™s leadership will propel us to new heights, while continuing to deliver innovative health data solutions and drive success for our clients and partners. Join us in welcoming Jeanne to LynxCare! ğŸŒŸ Click here to read the full communication: https://lnkd.in/e7zPGdJR

AI was the talk of the town at this yearâ€™s #worldeconomicforum! This event, hosted by FOUR and Ã‰cole polytechnique fÃ©dÃ©rale de Lausanne, was excellent and very different from the others. It was about building new ideas through conversation and connection across disciplines. We explored the collective responsibility we have as a community to realize the transformative power of AI in service of something precious to each of us and essential for a better world â€“ health. It's clear that no one person, technical solution, or entity is going to be able to bring the opportunity to bear alone. Itâ€™s on all of us. Very excited about the conversations we started and look forward to what will come from them going forward. Thank you to the panelists and our attendees - it was a pleasure to moderate this fascinating discussion. Big thanks to Presence Switzerland and #SwissHouse who provided a fantastic venue! Martin Vetterli | Karin Kimbrough | Gil Alterovitz, PhD, FACMI, FAMIA | Ashish Jha ğŸ“¸ Photo credit to GaÃ«l Hurlimann

If you are developing, designing and/or applying data science and AI methods in the healthcare and biomedical space, no matter your job title: we would love to hear from you! ğŸ”— : bumblekite.co/survey This work has been developed through hundreds of conversations with leaders from 40+ organisations encompassing 40+ countries, 1,000+ hospitals and tens of thousands of people like yourself. Most recently, the plenary session at the VA's Int. Summit for AI in Health Care, where we introduced this work, was the most viewed session of the Summit! Join us! ğŸ’™ ğŸ¨ : Francesca Sanna, Tamara Tica

Iâ€™m convinced that the digitalization of healthcare systems holds immense promise for securing healthcare, enhancing its sustainability, and bolstering its resilience against future crises. Within this transformative landscape, artificial intelligence plays a pivotal role in overcoming global challenges like the skilled-worker shortage. The question is no longer whether artificial intelligence should be integrated into healthcare, but rather how we can harness this game-changing technology to deliver the best possible patient care. Automation in clinical routines fosters the efficient and effective utilization of existing resources, enabling clinics and their specialists to focus on patient-centered care and execute precise treatments amidst an increasingly complex environment. However, realizing the full potential of precision medicine hinges on the prevailing framework conditions in our societies. Access to structured, high-quality health data is a key factor for research and development at companies like Siemens Healthineers. We need a regulated framework for accessing and sharing structured, high-quality health data in order to propel the digital transformation of healthcare and medicine. Iâ€™m truly privileged to have been a part of this interdisciplinary dialog on the future of healthcare alongside such a distinguished audience and insightful panelists. Thank you for this inspiring exchange, Ran Balicer, Alena Buyx, Barbara Frenz, Jeanne Kehren, Heyo Kroemer, Karl Lauterbach, Heike Schmoll, and Achim Wambach. #ArtificialIntelligence #Healthcare #Innovation
